comment: I agree the truth needs to come out. I know abuse against men has gotten worse. The laws need to be changed. It should not automatically be decided that when there is a call regarding a fight / argument between a Man and a Woman. The Man is automatically guilty. The whole situation needs to be investigated. Just like abuse on Children. And Children who are in homes where they are watching abuse.  The Child should be taken to a safe place. I'm not saying Foster care. But a safe place, where the Child feels safe enough to tell the truth on what they heard or saw. Not what they are being forced to say. When a Officer tries to speak with a Child who just witnessed one parent beating on the other. Especially if the parent who was beaten, lies and denies that the spouse did not beat them. And comes up with a story, the Child gets totally confused.  Doesn't understand why the abused parent is sticking up for the abuser. There has to be more programs put into effect to deal with the abuser and lier.  Hearing this letter, it sounds to me in my opinion that Whitney has had to live in her Older Sister's shadow. The Older Sister was projected as being the better Sister, maybe the prettier Sister, maybe the most intelligent Sister. When the reality is the Younger Sister is the one who helped the Older Sister to sit higher on the pedestal. And every time the Oldest Sister messes up. She goes crying to the younger Sister. She needs her help. And if the younger Sister doesn't help. Then everything that goes wrong in the Oldest Sisters life, is because of the younger Sister, according to the Oldest Sister. The Oldest Sister tells Family and Friends how spoiled the younger Sister is. According to the Oldest Sister, who does no wrong. Because she knows how to spin the story and everything the Oldest Sister knows she did wrong. She spins it and blames it all on the Younger Sister. The Younger Sister all She is trying to do is to get her Older Sister to tell the truth about everything.  Including all the lies, she told everyone about her Younger Sister. The Younger Sister is more afraid of the Older Sister. Because all of the Younger Sisters life was in the fake shadow of the Older Sisters life. People think the younger Sister is jealous of the Older Sister. Shes not, if the younger Sister is given the same chances as the Older Sister. And people would listen to the Younger Sister the same way they do to the Older Sister. They probably would be in for a big surprise. Narcissistic people, control who they want and everything is about them, no one is more important than themselves. And the people they need but will never admit it especially to them. The narcissistic person in their eyes, is always right and the ones they bully are nothing with out them.  It seems Whitney gets it both ways from a narcissistic so called Older Sister who also happens to be a narcissistic trying to be a breakout actress.

comment: Johnny is doing the right thing pursuing the injustice Amber has done to him.  First, if he didn't speak up, Amber would little by little encroach on the agreement not to discuss the relationship in public and she would keep her version of events alive in the mind of the public.  Second, he needed to recover his reputation in order to recover his career which was damaged my Amber's false accusations.  Third, for victims of DV - male and female - who were victims of smear campaigns by our abusers, he is facing his abuser and setting the record straight.  This is a case about DV.  What Amber did in setting Johnny up to be the abuser is what most abusers do - male and female.  The abuser is always the first one to get their story out and they frame the narrative.  The victim generally doesn't rush out with their story because of many factors. First, there is great shame with being abused by your partner so rushing out to admit the person who is supposed to love you has been beating on you isn't something victims rush to do.  Second, unless the victim is totally out of the relationship, coming forward to admit the abuse is a risk the victim takes that the abuser will amp up the abuse (and likely kill them) or end the relationship.  Third, there is a lot of trauma bonding (stockholm syndrome) in abuse relationships that leaves the victim mentally and emotionally bonded to the very person who is causing them great injury and this makes it difficult for the victim to report the abuse or even see the abuse.  When you listen to the audio just after they separated in which Amber is telling Johnny all the evidence she's been collecting to prove DV against him, Johnny is telling her how much he loves her.  It's clear -- after Amber cut off the tip of his finger, burned his face with a cigarette, thrown a can of red bull and paint thinner and pots and pans and filed a false claim of DV against him - that Johnny was trauma bonded to Amber.  Once he got enough separation from her, the trauma bond was eventually broken and he could see her for the abuser she is This case is an opportunity to see inside a relationship in which there was physical abuse and understand how an abuse victim gets trapped by the abuser.  Did Johnny behave badly? Yes, but a lot of that were set ups by Amber who was triangulating him.  She was also sabotaging his sobriety.  He went through detox and yet, this woman who claimed that drugs and alcohol drove his violence, kept bringing drugs and alcohol into the house.  We have to ask if what Amber says about Johnny is actually true about her - that drugs and alcohol were driving her violence against Johnny.
author: Been There

Ok so their marriage went south and she wanted to play the victim because it helped her career and she wanted to hurt Johnny Depp. If you look at the big picture of what happened between them that's the picture it all paints. I'm glad Johnny Depp is standing up for himself. People naturally assume that the man is always the abuser and they tend to believe smaller attractive women when they say they where abused. It's true. The public tends to believe good looking people more. Unfortunately that kind of thing happens all the time. And when it comes to celebs as successful as Depp they assume that he is a rich Jerk who is privileged and gotten way with abuse. He really did not have much free time to be abusive even if he wanted to because he had to be exhausted most of the time when he got home. Normal people couldn't keep up with his schedule.
